page.title: 02Description of Spennymoor
page.content: {A GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF {SPENNYMOOR,TUDHOE AND CROXDALE. THE TOWNSHIP OF SPENNYMOOR, COVERING SOME 7494 ACRES,WITH A POPULATION OF APPROX.20000, STANDS ON THE MAIN ROAD BETWEEN DURHAM AND BISHOP AUCKLAND (IN THE COUNTY PALATINE OF DURHAM),ON S.W.BANK OF THE RIVER WEAR. THE OLDEST AND MAIN PART OF PRESENT DAY SPENNYMOOR ORIGINALLY FORMED PART OF WHITWORTH TOWNSHIP. THE LANDS WERE OWNED BY THE SHAFTO FAMILY, "BONNIE BOBBY SHAFTO" OF THE FAMOUS SONG, BEING A MEMBER OF THIS FAMILY. TUDHOE VILLAGE AND TUDHOE COLLIERY ARE SATELLITES OF SPENNYMOOR AND ORIGINALLY FORMED PART OF TUDHOE TOWNSHIP, WHICH LAND WAS MAINLY OWNED BY THE SALVIN FAMILY OF CROXDALE. SINCE 1974 ALL HAVE BEEN PART OF SEDGEFIELD R.D.C.
